wikitext.*:
{{expansion}} {{video game infobox | image = Som2-1-.jpg | name=Shadows of Mordor
Shadows of Mordor Software Adventure | developer= | publisher=[[Melbourne House]] (Shadows of Mordor), [[Addison-Wesley]] (Shadows of Mordor Software Adventure) | platform= [[wikipedia:Amstrad CPC|Amstrad CPC]], [[wikipedia:Commodore 64|Commodore 64]], [[wikipedia:ZX Spectrum|ZX Spectrum]] (Shadows of Mordor)
[[wikipedia:Apple II series|Apple II]], [[wikipedia:Commodore 64|Commodore 64]], [[wikipedia:Macintosh|Macintosh]], [[wikipedia:MS-DOS|MS-DOS]] (Shadows of Mordor Software Adventure) | releasedate=[[1988]] | genre=Text-adventure (Amstrad CPC)
Text-adventure with illustrations (all others) }}'''''Shadows of Mordor''''', or '''''Shadows of Mordor Software Adventure''''' in North-America, is a video game that covers part 4 of ''[[The Lord of the Rings]]''.[http://www.lysator.liu.se/tolkien-games/entry/som.html Tolkien Games] (retrieved 3 December 2010) It is the sequel to ''[[Lord of the Rings: Game One]]'' and the precursor to ''[[Crack of Doom Software Adventure|Crack of Doom]]''.[http://www.meristation.com/v3/des_articulo.php?pic=CON&id=2254&idj=&idp=&tipo=art&c=1&pos=5 Meristation, El Anillo interactivo] p. 6 (retrieved 3 December 2010) It is part of the ''[[Tolkien Trilogy]]'', also known in North-America as [[The Tolkien Software Adventure Series]].[http://ifdb.tads.org/viewgame?id=fvvyotspkgrb223k The Interactive Fiction Database] (retrieved 3 December 2010)[http://www.worldofspectrum.org/infoseek.cgi Shadows of Mordor] at [[wikipedia:World of Spectrum|World of Spectrum]] The game was designed by [[Philip Mitchell]] and [[John Haward]]. {{References}} {{Videogames}} {{title|italics}} [[Category:Amstrad CPC games]] [[Category:Apple Macintosh games]] [[Category:Apple II series games]] [[Category:Commodore 64 games]] [[Category:Melbourne House games]] [[Category:Text-Adventure video games]] [[Category:ZX Spectrum games]]
